messages.title: How we can change the future together

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP wants a FAIRER Australian-style points-based system to decide who comes to work and settle here.
UKIP will pour £3 billion a year EXTRA into the NHS to keep it as a free public service, funded by scrapping of the £55 million a day EU membership fee.
UKIP will SCRAP income tax on the minimum wage, SCRAP the bedroom tax, and SCRAP the tax on your children when you die.
By stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £350 million a day spent on foreign aid, UKIP is the ONLY PARTY with money to spend at home.

issues.health: UKIP will pour £3 billion a year EXTRA into the NHS to keep it as a free public service.
issues.immigration: UKIP wants a FAIRER Australian-style points-based system to decide who comes to work and settle here.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm a local teacher who's lived in Huddersfield for 30 years. My children were born in the HRI and went to local state schools. My Dad was a miner, a nurse and a teacher. I believe it's through education that people, without money or privilege, can thrive. I'm committed to improving the way we live. My priorities are our children, the best, to give our children the greatest possible chance in life. As a user of the NHS, I want to defend the NHS, for all our citizens and to create more high-skilled, high-paying local jobs.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by Derek Barker, 21 Cherry Way, Liversedge, WF15 8EL. Printed by Media Monkey, UK

images.caption: Rob Butler in Huddersfield Standing Up for Real Change
